name: core-rules
rules: Never mention Claude in commits - Use generic language for AI-generated content markers
Format: <type>: <description> (imperative, lowercase, â‰¤50 chars)
Types: feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, chore
Focus: One logical change per commit
Keep functions < 20 lines, do one thing well, < 4 parameters
Use intention-revealing, pronounceable, searchable names
Explain 'why' not 'what' in comments, remove dead code
Use exceptions, handle at appropriate levels
Classes and functions have one clear purpose
60% minimum (acceptable), 80% target (commendable) test coverage
Test interfaces, not implementations
Tests must be deterministic, isolated, and fast
Never treat 4xx/5xx/timeout responses as success
Do not rely on global process state, seeded databases, or external services
Never introduce skip, xfail, or similar tooling to bypass a failing path
Verify observable behavior and return values instead of mock call counts
Assert the exact status code and contractually required payload
Never embed real credentials, bearer tokens, or host-specific secrets
Never hard-code OS-specific paths
Use path.resolve() or path.join() instead of string concatenation
Separation of Concerns: Distinct features with minimal overlap
Modularity: Independent development, testing, deployment
Scalability: Design for horizontal scaling
Maintainability: Simplicity over cleverness
